venue.name: Artesani Playground in Herter Park DCR (formerly MDC)

item.description:
Feliz Dia da Independencia!

Let's join the Brazilian Independence celebration organized by the Brazilian Women's Group

Bring cash so you can purchase tasty food from the vendors.

Of course you're free to get there when you can and hang as long as you're able on your own but if you want to be with a group, I'll wait for you from 11:30 until 11:45 at the corner of 374 Everett Street and 1200 Soldiers Field Road. This Google map link shows a photo of the meeting point http://maps.google.co...

At 11:45 I'll cross at the traffic lights to the Artesani Playground sign which is about 100 feet or 30 meters away on the left side of the parking lot. I'll wait at the Artesani Playground sign until 11:55 then leave from there to find a spot to enjoy the festivities.

I will be leaving the park at 2 because I am checking out the Cambridge Carnival in Kendall Square on Main Street. All are welcome to join me for this carnival celebration. My plan is to watch the parade of colorfully costumed folks and listen to the bands on the stages. Check out this Onyxbirds Meetup link for details, http://www.meetup.com...

Attractions:
• 12 pm Official opening – performance of the Brazilian National Anthem by Daniela Speziale
• Festival Opening Parade with Marcus Santos and AfroBrazil
• Children’s activities (pony ride, face painting and drawing)
• Boston Museum of Science
• New England Aquarium
• Meet, greet and welcome the New England Revolution star, Brazilian Roberto "Betu" Linck
• Ethnic food, Information and Service Stands

Live Performances:
• Afro Orpheu Musical
• Forro Band Cabras da Peste
• Dance Performance by Moves & Vibes Co.
• Capoeira with Mestre Chuvisco
• David Ramos e Samba no Pé

Handicap accessible

Where to park free of charge:
• 1300 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston MA
• 1120 Soldiers Field Rd, Boston MA
• 43 Holton St, Boston MA (St Anthony's)

Parking in front of DCR Herter Park (1175 Soldiers Field Road) will be reserved solely for Festival vendors and organizers


Check out MBTA or Hop Stop to create your route by public transit.


You may call or text my cell (617) 445-7549 if you need help finding the group.
